WorkItem.ClosedComment: Issue closed, when something like this happens, the end user just needs to run a refresh on their entire database. That would correct 98% of their issues. Don't get all whiny with us about it, it doesn't change what you need to do.
WorkItem.Description:
I am unable to see the emblem of frost gear for any of my slots.  I don't have the filter unchecked.  I have tried to uncheck and recheck, but they still won't show.
I could see them with 3.11.
WorkItem.Summary: [Items] Not showing Emblem of Frost items

Comments.Message: Check other filters; you have something else filtering them out.

I found many of the frost emblem items had incorrect data with 3.12.    Once I updated them from Armory, it was all fixed.

Just leave everything deselected except the "Other" filter then update all those items from armory and you are good to go again.
I noticed this too with the latest item cache, for the next version we'll probably want to refresh these items in the item cache.

"Just leave everything deselected except the "Other" filter then update all those items from armory and you are good to go again."

That worked for me. Thank you!

Please re-release with the frost items back in the item list... to force the users to do a full item update from the armory, which on my PC takes hours, and then to call it a "low" impact bug on top of it is not good manners.

...'call it a low impact bug'?
...manners?

Wow. Seriously? Get a clue.
I'm not sure I understand... are you still saying this is not an issue?  The item list in not correct in 3.1.2, why wouldn't you put out a corrected release immediately?

All the items are there, the individual items just need to be updated (right click then select Update item from Armory) which takes a second or two.     Yes it is an issue that needs to be fixed, but it isn't that much of a hassle.   

New versions come out every few weeks which means it won't be too long till  the next version comes out and this is fixed. 

If necessary, download the 2.3.11 version and copy the ItemCache.XML & ItemSource.XML files over into the new version  (or just use the older version of Rawr - most classes didn't have massive changes).        ***** I'm pretty sure those are the two files needed - -if wrong, someone please correct me *****
